snippet: The American ambassador to Syria, Robert S. Ford, told Congress that without a negotiated political transition, supporters of the Assad government “would fight to the death.”
abstract: American officials warn that Syria could face protracted, bloody conflict even if rebels succeed in ousting Pres Bashar al-Assad.

byline.original: By MARK LANDLER and ERIC SCHMITT

lead_paragraph: The American ambassador to Syria, Robert S. Ford, told Congress that without a negotiated political transition, supporters of the Assad government “would fight to the death.”

headline.seo: Rebel Victory in Syria Might Not Stop Conflict, U.S. Officials Say
headline.main: Rebel Victory in Syria Might Not Stop Conflict, U.S. Officials Say
headline.print_headline: Rebel Victory in Syria Might Not Stop Conflict, U.S. Officials Say
